sn11.21:1.2: And then Sakka, lord of gods, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side,
sn11.21:2.1: “When what is incinerated do you sleep at ease?
sn11.21:2.2: When what is incinerated is there no sorrow?
sn11.21:3.1: “When anger’s incinerated you sleep at ease.
sn11.21:3.2: When anger’s incinerated there is no sorrow.
sn11.21:3.3: O Vāsava, anger has a poisoned root
sn11.21:3.5: The noble ones praise its killing,
sn11.21:3.6: for when it’s incinerated there is no sorrow.”
